title: House Hero
desc: ERP System for Tourist Accommodation Managemen

body.text: Bachelor thesis: a lightweight ERP web app for housekeeping and property management with real-time updates and role-based access.

House Hero is a full-stack web application that centralizes daily operations for tourist accommodations. It works as a lightweight ERP with task automation, real-time synchronization, and role-based access (Admin, Housekeeper, Maintenance, Guest).

Inspiration: The system was originally designed for my family business, where my mother manages housekeeping and house management across multiple properties. Real coordination challenges shaped the requirements and informed the UX.

body.caption: Admin Dashboard: Booking management with calendar.
Admin Dashboard: Booking management with calendar, mobile view.

body.text: Tech Stack

text: Frontend: React + Ionic
Backend & Database: Firebase (Firestore NoSQL)
Authentication: Firebase Authentication
Hosting & CI/CD: GitHub + Netlify

body.text: Core Features

text: Booking management with calendar and real-time synchronization
Role-based permissions for Admin, Housekeeper, Maintenance, and Guest users
Property and linen database with editable details
Lost & Found tracking per property
Automated check-in / check-out and mid-stay cleaning tasks
Maintenance reports with assignment and status tracking
Evaluated with real users from the family business for practical feedback

body.text: Outcome

Replaces manual communication and paperwork with a single connected system, speeding up coordination and improving transparency. Demonstrates practical full-stack development, UX/UI design, and real-time data architecture in an ERP context.

title: Kerkira Vibes
desc: Collaborative Corfu Guide for People Who Want to Escape the Crowds

body.text: A collaborative summer side project, a minimal web guide for exploring authentic Corfu spots without the tourist chaos.

Kerkira Vibes is a collaborative summer project, a small web guide for people visiting Corfu who want to explore the island without getting lost in the classic tourist crowd. The idea came up while talking with friends about what you can actually do in Corfu during the summer without being surrounded by mass tourism.
Idea

The goal was to create a calm and minimal space that highlights authentic local options, cafés, and experiences that still feel like Corfu. Instead of another 'top 10' list, we wanted something that feels more personal and human.

text: Chill cafés
Spots
Local vibes and small music events

body.text: Collaboration & Tech Stack

text: Development: HTML, CSS, JavaScript - implemented by me
Design: Created by a colleague and friend, focusing on a clean, summer-inspired visual style
Hosting: Netlify
Extras: Custom color palette and Ionian sea-inspired tones

body.text: Outcome

Kerkira Vibes isn’t meant to be a full travel guide, it’s more like a digital postcard from locals to visitors who want a slower, more authentic experience of Corfu. A small, light-hearted project that mixes collaboration, design, and code — built just for fun.
A personal blog built around Web Components and templates — designed to reuse layouts, simplify content updates, and make maintaining posts effortless.

This project began as an experiment to see how far I could go using Web Components and templates to build a personal blog that’s both flexible and easy to maintain. I wanted a setup where I don’t need to create a new HTML page for every post — everything is reusable and data-driven.
Idea & Goals

text: Reusable components (header, grids, cards) for a consistent UI
Template-based archive and single views to avoid repetitive code
Content stored in JSON or Markdown for easy editing
Lightweight, fast, and mobile-first structure

body.text: Architecture

text: Built with native Web Components / Custom Elements
Data-driven rendering from JSON files like posts.json and projects.json
Simple routing using query parameters (e.g. ?p=slug) for single pages
Each page template reads the body schema (p, h2, ul, img) and renders dynamically

body.text: Content Workflow

text: Add or update entries in JSON, they appear instantly on the site
Reuse the same components for homepage, archive, and single pages
No copy-paste, consistent design system across the whole site

body.text: Tech Stack

text: HTML, CSS, JavaScript (Custom Elements)
Static hosting via GitHub Pages or Netlify
Light setup — no heavy frameworks required

body.caption: Personal Blog — component-first, template-driven, and content-friendly.
